hints.label: lem-mean-third-derivative
hints.title: k-Uniform Third Derivative of Localized Mean (Full Model)
hints.content:
1152: :label: lem-mean-third-derivative
1153: 
1154: The localized mean for the companion-dependent model $\mu_\rho^{(i)} := \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} w_{ij}(\rho) \, d_j$ (where $d_j = \mathbb{E}[d_{\text{alg}}(j, c(j))]$) satisfies:
1155: $$
1156: \|\nabla^3_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)}\| \leq K_{\mu,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c)
1157: $$
1158: 
1159: where $C_{d,m}$ denote constants from the bounds $\|\nabla^m d_j\|$ (from Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-derivative-locality-c3`), and:
1160: 
1161: $$
1162: K_{\mu,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c) := C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2} + \frac{6 C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} + \frac{6 C_{d,1} C_{\nabla^2 K}(\rho)}{\rho^2} k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} + 2 D_{\max} C_{w,3}(\rho) k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1163: $$
1164: 
1165: **Note on $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$ dependence**: The last three terms (those involving weight derivatives) scale with $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} \leq C_{\text{vol}} \rho_{\max} \rho^{2d}$. When $C_{w,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{-3})$, the bound scales as $K_{\mu,3} = O(\varepsilon_d^{-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-1}) + O(\rho^{2d-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-3})$, matching Document 20's $m=3$ formula.
hints.raw_directive:
1149: ### 5.1. Third Derivative of Localized Mean (Companion-Dependent Model)
1150: 
1151: :::{prf:lemma} k-Uniform Third Derivative of Localized Mean (Full Model)
1152: :label: lem-mean-third-derivative
1153: 
1154: The localized mean for the companion-dependent model $\mu_\rho^{(i)} := \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} w_{ij}(\rho) \, d_j$ (where $d_j = \mathbb{E}[d_{\text{alg}}(j, c(j))]$) satisfies:
1155: $$
1156: \|\nabla^3_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)}\| \leq K_{\mu,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c)
1157: $$
1158: 
1159: where $C_{d,m}$ denote constants from the bounds $\|\nabla^m d_j\|$ (from Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-derivative-locality-c3`), and:
1160: 
1161: $$
1162: K_{\mu,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c) := C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2} + \frac{6 C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} + \frac{6 C_{d,1} C_{\nabla^2 K}(\rho)}{\rho^2} k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} + 2 D_{\max} C_{w,3}(\rho) k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1163: $$
1164: 
1165: **Note on $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$ dependence**: The last three terms (those involving weight derivatives) scale with $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} \leq C_{\text{vol}} \rho_{\max} \rho^{2d}$. When $C_{w,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{-3})$, the bound scales as $K_{\mu,3} = O(\varepsilon_d^{-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-1}) + O(\rho^{2d-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-3})$, matching Document 20's $m=3$ formula.
1166:

hints.label: proof-lem-mean-third-derivative
hints.content:
1171: :label: proof-lem-mean-third-derivative
1172: 
1173: **Overview**: Unlike the simplified model, companion-dependent measurements $d_j$ depend on $x_i$ for ALL walkers $j$ (via softmax coupling). We apply Leibniz rule to all products $w_{ij} \cdot d_j$, using **derivative locality** (§2.5.4) to maintain k-uniformity.
1174: 
1175: **Step 1: Product rule for all terms.**
1176: 
1177: The mean is $\mu_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} w_{ij}(\rho) \cdot d_j$ where $d_j = \mathbb{E}[d_{\text{alg}}(j, c(j))]$. Apply Leibniz rule for third derivatives:
1178: $$
1179: \nabla^3_{x_i} [w_{ij} \cdot d_j] = \sum_{k=0}^{3} \binom{3}{k} (\nabla^k_{x_i} w_{ij}) \cdot (\nabla^{3-k}_{x_i} d_j)
1180: $$
1181: 
1182: Expanding all four terms:
1183: $$
1184: \nabla^3_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \left[w_{ij} \nabla^3 d_j + 3(\nabla w_{ij})(\nabla^2 d_j) + 3(\nabla^2 w_{ij})(\nabla d_j) + (\nabla^3 w_{ij}) d_j\right]
1185: $$
1186: 
1187: **Step 2: Apply derivative bounds for ALL j.**
1188: 
1189: **For j ≠ i**: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-derivative-locality-c3` (derivative locality):
1190: - $\|\nabla^3_{x_i} d_j\| \leq C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}$ (k-uniform due to derivative locality)
1191: 
1192: **For j = i**: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-self-measurement-derivatives` (self-measurement):
1193: - $\|\nabla^3_{x_i} d_i\| \leq C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}$ (k-uniform due to normalization $\sum_{\ell} P_{i\ell} = 1$)
1194: 
1195: **Key Result**: Despite different mechanisms (derivative locality for j≠i, expectation normalization for j=i), BOTH cases give the **same k-uniform bound** with the **same constant** $C_{d,3}$.
1196: 
1197: Therefore, for all $j \in \mathcal{A}$:
1198: - $\|\nabla^3_{x_i} d_j\| \leq C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}$ (k-uniform)
1199: - $\|\nabla^2_{x_i} d_j\| \leq C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1}$ (k-uniform)
1200: - $\|\nabla_{x_i} d_j\| \leq C_{d,1}$ (k-uniform)
1201: - $|d_j| \leq D_{\max}$ (bounded by diameter)
1202: 
1203: **Term 1**: $\sum_j w_{ij} \nabla^3 d_j$
1204: $$
1205: \left\|\sum_j w_{ij} \nabla^3 d_j\right\| \leq \left(\sum_j w_{ij}\right) \cdot C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2} = C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}
1206: $$
1207: 
1208: (using normalization $\sum_j w_{ij} = 1$)
1209: 
1210: **Term 2**: $3 \sum_j (\nabla w_{ij})(\nabla^2 d_j)$
1211: $$
1212: \left\|\sum_j (\nabla w_{ij})(\nabla^2 d_j)\right\| \leq C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} \sum_j \|\nabla w_{ij}\| \leq C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} \cdot \frac{C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} \cdot k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1213: $$
1214: 
1215: where $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = O(\rho^{2d})$ is k-uniform (exponential localization of Gaussian weights).
1216: 
1217: **Term 3**: $3 \sum_j (\nabla^2 w_{ij})(\nabla d_j)$
1218: $$
1219: \left\|\sum_j (\nabla^2 w_{ij})(\nabla d_j)\right\| \leq C_{d,1} \sum_j \|\nabla^2 w_{ij}\| \leq C_{d,1} \cdot \frac{C_{\nabla^2 K}(\rho)}{\rho^2} \cdot k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1220: $$
1221: 
1222: **Term 4**: $\sum_j (\nabla^3 w_{ij}) d_j$
1223: 
1224: Apply telescoping identity $\sum_j \nabla^3 w_{ij} = 0$:
1225: $$
1226: \sum_j (\nabla^3 w_{ij}) d_j = \sum_j (\nabla^3 w_{ij})(d_j - d_i)
1227: $$
1228: 
1229: By exponential localization, $\|\nabla^3 w_{ij}\|$ is significant only for $j$ with $d_{\text{alg}}(i,j) = O(\rho)$. For such $j$:
1230: $$
1231: |d_j - d_i| \leq 2D_{\max} \quad \text{(worst case)}
1232: $$
1233: 
1234: Therefore:
1235: $$
1236: \left\|\sum_j (\nabla^3 w_{ij}) d_j\right\| \leq D_{\max} \sum_j \|\nabla^3 w_{ij}\| \leq D_{\max} \cdot C_{w,3}(\rho) \cdot k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1237: $$
1238: 
1239: **Step 4: Combine and absorb $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$ into constants.**
1240: 
1241: 
1242: Since $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = O(\rho^{2d})$ is k-uniform, we can absorb it into the constants:
1243: $$
1244: \begin{aligned}
1245: \|\nabla^3 \mu_\rho^{(i)}\| &\leq C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2} + 3 C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} \frac{C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} \\
1246: &\quad + 3 C_{d,1} \frac{C_{\nabla^2 K}(\rho)}{\rho^2} k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} + D_{\max} C_{w,3}(\rho) k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1247: \end{aligned}
1248: 
1249: 
1250: where the bound has been split into:
1251: 1. **First term** ($C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}$): From $\sum_j w_{ij} \nabla^3 d_j$ with normalization $\sum_j w_{ij} = 1$ (no $k_{\text{eff}}$ factor)
1252: 2. **Remaining terms**: From weight-derivative products, each scaled by $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} \leq C_{\text{vol}} \rho_{\max} \rho^{2d}$
1253: 
1254: Substituting $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} \leq C_{\text{vol}} \rho_{\max} \rho^{2d}$ into the bound matches the definition of $K_{\mu,3}$ from the lemma statement (equation in §5.1 header), which keeps the $\rho^{-1}, \rho^{-2}, \rho^{-3}$ factors explicit:
1255: $$
1256: K_{\mu,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c) = C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2} + 6 C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} \frac{C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} C_{\text{vol}} \rho_{\max} \rho^{2d} + \cdots
1257: $$
1258: 
1259: This gives $K_{\mu,3} = O(\varepsilon_d^{-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-1}) + O(\rho^{2d-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-3})$, which matches Document 20's $m=3$ scaling.
1260: $$
1261: 
1262: **Step 5: Verify k-uniformity.**
1263: 
1264: Each component:
1265: - $C_{d,3}$, $C_{d,2}$, $C_{d,1}$: k-uniform by derivative locality (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-derivative-locality-c3`)
1266: - Weight bounds $C_{\nabla K}$, $C_{\nabla^2 K}$, $C_{w,3}$: k-uniform (kernel derivatives independent of $k$)
1267: - $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = O(\rho^{2d})$: k-uniform (depends only on $\rho$ and dimension $d$)
hints.raw_directive:
1168: :::
1169: 
1170: :::{prf:proof}
1171: :label: proof-lem-mean-third-derivative
1172: 
1173: **Overview**: Unlike the simplified model, companion-dependent measurements $d_j$ depend on $x_i$ for ALL walkers $j$ (via softmax coupling). We apply Leibniz rule to all products $w_{ij} \cdot d_j$, using **derivative locality** (§2.5.4) to maintain k-uniformity.
1174: 
1175: **Step 1: Product rule for all terms.**
1176: 
1177: The mean is $\mu_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} w_{ij}(\rho) \cdot d_j$ where $d_j = \mathbb{E}[d_{\text{alg}}(j, c(j))]$. Apply Leibniz rule for third derivatives:
1178: $$
1179: \nabla^3_{x_i} [w_{ij} \cdot d_j] = \sum_{k=0}^{3} \binom{3}{k} (\nabla^k_{x_i} w_{ij}) \cdot (\nabla^{3-k}_{x_i} d_j)
1180: $$
1181: 
1182: Expanding all four terms:
1183: $$
1184: \nabla^3_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \left[w_{ij} \nabla^3 d_j + 3(\nabla w_{ij})(\nabla^2 d_j) + 3(\nabla^2 w_{ij})(\nabla d_j) + (\nabla^3 w_{ij}) d_j\right]
1185: $$
1186: 
1187: **Step 2: Apply derivative bounds for ALL j.**
1188: 
1189: **For j ≠ i**: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-derivative-locality-c3` (derivative locality):
1190: - $\|\nabla^3_{x_i} d_j\| \leq C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}$ (k-uniform due to derivative locality)
1191: 
1192: **For j = i**: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-self-measurement-derivatives` (self-measurement):
1193: - $\|\nabla^3_{x_i} d_i\| \leq C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}$ (k-uniform due to normalization $\sum_{\ell} P_{i\ell} = 1$)
1194: 
1195: **Key Result**: Despite different mechanisms (derivative locality for j≠i, expectation normalization for j=i), BOTH cases give the **same k-uniform bound** with the **same constant** $C_{d,3}$.
1196: 
1197: Therefore, for all $j \in \mathcal{A}$:
1198: - $\|\nabla^3_{x_i} d_j\| \leq C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}$ (k-uniform)
1199: - $\|\nabla^2_{x_i} d_j\| \leq C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1}$ (k-uniform)
1200: - $\|\nabla_{x_i} d_j\| \leq C_{d,1}$ (k-uniform)
1201: - $|d_j| \leq D_{\max}$ (bounded by diameter)
1202: 
1203: **Term 1**: $\sum_j w_{ij} \nabla^3 d_j$
1204: $$
1205: \left\|\sum_j w_{ij} \nabla^3 d_j\right\| \leq \left(\sum_j w_{ij}\right) \cdot C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2} = C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}
1206: $$
1207: 
1208: (using normalization $\sum_j w_{ij} = 1$)
1209: 
1210: **Term 2**: $3 \sum_j (\nabla w_{ij})(\nabla^2 d_j)$
1211: $$
1212: \left\|\sum_j (\nabla w_{ij})(\nabla^2 d_j)\right\| \leq C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} \sum_j \|\nabla w_{ij}\| \leq C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} \cdot \frac{C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} \cdot k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1213: $$
1214: 
1215: where $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = O(\rho^{2d})$ is k-uniform (exponential localization of Gaussian weights).
1216: 
1217: **Term 3**: $3 \sum_j (\nabla^2 w_{ij})(\nabla d_j)$
1218: $$
1219: \left\|\sum_j (\nabla^2 w_{ij})(\nabla d_j)\right\| \leq C_{d,1} \sum_j \|\nabla^2 w_{ij}\| \leq C_{d,1} \cdot \frac{C_{\nabla^2 K}(\rho)}{\rho^2} \cdot k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1220: $$
1221: 
1222: **Term 4**: $\sum_j (\nabla^3 w_{ij}) d_j$
1223: 
1224: Apply telescoping identity $\sum_j \nabla^3 w_{ij} = 0$:
1225: $$
1226: \sum_j (\nabla^3 w_{ij}) d_j = \sum_j (\nabla^3 w_{ij})(d_j - d_i)
1227: $$
1228: 
1229: By exponential localization, $\|\nabla^3 w_{ij}\|$ is significant only for $j$ with $d_{\text{alg}}(i,j) = O(\rho)$. For such $j$:
1230: $$
1231: |d_j - d_i| \leq 2D_{\max} \quad \text{(worst case)}
1232: $$
1233: 
1234: Therefore:
1235: $$
1236: \left\|\sum_j (\nabla^3 w_{ij}) d_j\right\| \leq D_{\max} \sum_j \|\nabla^3 w_{ij}\| \leq D_{\max} \cdot C_{w,3}(\rho) \cdot k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1237: $$
1238: 
1239: **Step 4: Combine and absorb $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$ into constants.**
1240: 
1241: 
1242: Since $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = O(\rho^{2d})$ is k-uniform, we can absorb it into the constants:
1243: $$
1244: \begin{aligned}
1245: \|\nabla^3 \mu_\rho^{(i)}\| &\leq C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2} + 3 C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} \frac{C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} \\
1246: &\quad + 3 C_{d,1} \frac{C_{\nabla^2 K}(\rho)}{\rho^2} k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} + D_{\max} C_{w,3}(\rho) k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}
1247: \end{aligned}
1248: 
1249: 
1250: where the bound has been split into:
1251: 1. **First term** ($C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2}$): From $\sum_j w_{ij} \nabla^3 d_j$ with normalization $\sum_j w_{ij} = 1$ (no $k_{\text{eff}}$ factor)
1252: 2. **Remaining terms**: From weight-derivative products, each scaled by $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} \leq C_{\text{vol}} \rho_{\max} \rho^{2d}$
1253: 
1254: Substituting $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} \leq C_{\text{vol}} \rho_{\max} \rho^{2d}$ into the bound matches the definition of $K_{\mu,3}$ from the lemma statement (equation in §5.1 header), which keeps the $\rho^{-1}, \rho^{-2}, \rho^{-3}$ factors explicit:
1255: $$
1256: K_{\mu,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c) = C_{d,3} \varepsilon_d^{-2} + 6 C_{d,2} \varepsilon_d^{-1} \frac{C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} C_{\text{vol}} \rho_{\max} \rho^{2d} + \cdots
1257: $$
1258: 
1259: This gives $K_{\mu,3} = O(\varepsilon_d^{-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-1}) + O(\rho^{2d-2}) + O(\rho^{2d-3})$, which matches Document 20's $m=3$ scaling.
1260: $$
1261: 
1262: **Step 5: Verify k-uniformity.**
1263: 
1264: Each component:
1265: - $C_{d,3}$, $C_{d,2}$, $C_{d,1}$: k-uniform by derivative locality (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-derivative-locality-c3`)
1266: - Weight bounds $C_{\nabla K}$, $C_{\nabla^2 K}$, $C_{w,3}$: k-uniform (kernel derivatives independent of $k$)
1267: - $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = O(\rho^{2d})$: k-uniform (depends only on $\rho$ and dimension $d$)
1268:

hints.label: lem-variance-third-derivative
hints.title: k-Uniform Third Derivative of Localized Variance (Full Model)
hints.content:
1276: :label: lem-variance-third-derivative
1277: 
1278: The localized variance for the companion-dependent model $V_\rho^{(i)} := \sigma^2_\rho[f_k, x_i] = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} w_{ij}(\rho) d_j^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2$ (where $d_j = \mathbb{E}[d_{\text{alg}}(j, c(j))]$) satisfies:
1279: $$
1280: \|\nabla^3_{x_i} V_\rho^{(i)}\| \leq K_{V,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c)
1281: $$
1282: 
1283: where $K_{V,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c)$ is a k-uniform constant (explicit formula in proof).
hints.raw_directive:
1273: 
1274: 
1275: :::{prf:lemma} k-Uniform Third Derivative of Localized Variance (Full Model)
1276: :label: lem-variance-third-derivative
1277: 
1278: The localized variance for the companion-dependent model $V_\rho^{(i)} := \sigma^2_\rho[f_k, x_i] = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} w_{ij}(\rho) d_j^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2$ (where $d_j = \mathbb{E}[d_{\text{alg}}(j, c(j))]$) satisfies:
1279: $$
1280: \|\nabla^3_{x_i} V_\rho^{(i)}\| \leq K_{V,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c)
1281: $$
1282: 
1283: where $K_{V,3}(\rho, \varepsilon_d, \varepsilon_c)$ is a k-uniform constant (explicit formula in proof).
1284:
